keywords: convenience@serve with salad for complete meal
subtitle: A good dish for entertaining as you can prepare it all beforehand.

method.text: Bring a frying pan full of water to the boil. Add the oil. Blanch the fresh lasagne sheets, one at a time, in the boiling water for 2-3 min or until softened slightly. Remove from pan and refresh under cold running water. Repeat with remaining sheets and set aside.

In a large saucepan, dry fry the mince for 2-3 min or until the fat begins to run from the mince. Add the onion, garlic, carrots and celery and cook for 8-10 min or until mince is well browned and vegetables are tender.
Stir the chopped tomatoes, tomato puree, Worcestershire sauce, seasoning, oregano and red wine into the pan. Bring to the boil, reduce heat and simmer gently for 15-20 min stirring occasionally.
Arrange two sheets of lasagne in the base of a lightly greased ovenproof dish. Top with a third of the mince mixture and spoon over a third of the cheese sauce.

Repeat the layers twice more as above, ending up with a top layer of cheese sauce. Mix together the cheeses and breadcrumbs and sprinkle over the top. Cook in the oven for 40 min or until golden and piping hot.

title: Classic lasagne
